title: 'ThnnConv2DBackward' object has no attribute 'padding'
body_html:
For Pytorch 0.2.0 and 0.3.1, we can access the layer settings by accessing grad_fn objects. But in Pytorch 0.4.0, this property seems disappear.

For example,

import torch
import torch.nn as nn

net = nn.Conv2d(3, 12, kernel_size=3, stride=2, padding=1, dilation=1, groups=3, bias=False)
input = torch.rand(1,3,224,224,requires_grad=True)
output = net(input)
output.grad_fn.next_functions[0][0].padding

AttributeError: 'ThnnConv2DBackward' object has no attribute 'padding'

Also, it seems hard to recognize the groups of nn.Conv2d.

body:
For Pytorch 0.2.0 and 0.3.1, we can access the layer settings by accessing `grad_fn` objects. But in Pytorch 0.4.0, this property seems disappear. 

For example,

```
import torch
import torch.nn as nn

net = nn.Conv2d(3, 12, kernel_size=3, stride=2, padding=1, dilation=1, groups=3, bias=False)
input = torch.rand(1,3,224,224,requires_grad=True)
output = net(input)
output.grad_fn.next_functions[0][0].padding

AttributeError: 'ThnnConv2DBackward' object has no attribute 'padding'
```

Also, it seems hard to recognize the groups of nn.Conv2d.
